question: How could line 3 be changed to improve the program overall?

answers.text: Use float() instead of int().

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Adding str() around int() doesn't change the calculation or output. Will enough pizza be ordered if the calculation produces a fractional part?

answers.text: Add 1 to the result of int().

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: A pizza order should be a whole number, but a fractional part is still important. For a calculation of 7.5, should 7 or 8 pizzas be ordered?

answers.text: Add str() around int().

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: int() removes any fractional part. Many calculations will produce a fractional part. Ex: 46 people with 3.0 slices per person will need 138 slices or 17.25 pizzas. int(17.25) is 17, so adding 1 produces 18 pizzas, a better estimate to ensure enough pizza is ordered.

detailedSolution: int() removes any fractional part. Many calculations will produce a fractional part. Ex: 46 people with 3.0 slices per person will need 138 slices or 17.25 pizzas. int(17.25) is 17, so adding 1 produces 18 pizzas, a better estimate to ensure enough pizza is ordered.
